Yes Michael, I was amending my classes on the command prompt.
I studied the heritrix wrapper and I found the following

# Ignore previous classpath.  Build one that contains heritrix jar and content
# of the lib directory into the variable CP.
for jar in `ls $HERITRIX_HOME/lib/*.jar $HERITRIX_HOME/*.jar`
do
    CP=${CP}:${jar}
done


I bundled my classes in a jar file called(addition.jar), I put this jar in my lib folder and when i try to begin heritrix , it fails to start.
I do not know how can I set the classpath on the previous paragraph

thanks

Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:                                      ahmed ghouzia wrote: 
       ....
   
 5- The new classes are put in a folder and i added this folder to my $CLASSPATH
 The classes are located in 
   
   /root/research/sources/metacombine/metacombine/org/metacombine/crawlmodule
   
 and my classpath is 
   
 export CLASSPATH=/root/research/sources/metacombine/metacombine:.
   
   
        
 
 
 Going by the exception, the above is not having the intended effect.  Where are you amending the CLASSPATH?  In the heritrix wrapper script or just on the command-line?  If the latter, it won't work.  Study the heritrix wrapper script for why.  One of the first comments says:
 
 # Ignore previous classpath.  Build one that contains heritrix jar and content
 # of the lib directory into the variable CP.
 
 St.Ack
